5 spots for live music

Louisville 7:27 a.m. EST November 26, 2014

Drawing of a musical half note(Photo: Getty Images)

1 CONNECT 4 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Mercury Ballroom. 611 S. Fourth St. Friday, Goodtimers Annual Fade to Black, Black Friday Birthday Celebration with DJs Efeezy and Znyce, $20. Saturday, Chase Rice: Ignite the Night Tour, $20.

The New Vintage. 2126 S Preston St. Thursday, Purling Hiss, State Champion. Friday, Three Legged Race, Joe Clark, Eric Lanham. Saturday, Friendsgiving with Moonlight Peddlers, $5.

Zanzabar. 2100 S. Preston. Friday, Karass, Thing Shape, $5. Saturday, Kat Dahlia, Craig Stickland, $12.

Gerstle's Place. 3801 Frankfort Ave. Thursday, Me & You. Friday, 64 West, War Panties. Saturday, Thumper & the Plaid Rabbits, Happy Hour, Sand Bar Soul. Sunday, The Pranksters. Monday, Petar Mandic. Tuesday, Strung Out Loud. Dec. 3, Kimmet & Doug.

Jim Porter's. 2345 Lexington Road. Friday, 1 p.m., Black Friday Ball with Youngstown Parade, Circus, Big Dogs Bite, Mean Streak, Addiction, Six Miles South, The Tarnations, The Over-Reactors, Holly Nelson, Drunk & Sailor, Brian Elmore, Ashley Ledrick, Drew Alexander, Joe D'Amato. Benefiting the Make-A-Wish Foundation; families welcome until 10 p.m., $10. Friday and Saturday, Rick Barlett's Rockin' Soul Revival, The Degenerates, Bluestown. Tuesday, Bop Night. Dec. 3, Mixed Bag Wednesday.

AROUND TOWN: 5 fun things this week

TAKE THE KIDS: Top fun things for families

ON STAGE: Productions now playing

And lots more live music around town

Downtown

Blu Italian Mediterranean Grille. 280 W. Jefferson St. Thursday, Bourbon and Bluegrass; sample signature Kentucky bourbons while listening to Hickory Vaught and Friends. Sunday, 10:30 a.m.-2 p.m., brunch with jazz by The Dave Clark Jazz Trio.

Decca Restaurant and Lounge. 812 E. Market St. Saturday, Twin Limb, Jeremy Perry. Monday, The Buzzard.

Haymarket Whiskey Bar. 331 E. Market St. Thursday, Haymarket Friendsgiving. Dec. 3, Absinthe Night with Cooper & Kings.

Howl at the Moon. 434 S. Fourth St. Saturday, Dueling Piano Band and drink specials.

The Ice House. 217 E. Main St. Friday, 5, Beer and Loathing in Louisville, Gonzo-style beer festival. Features Hunter S. Thompson look-alike contest; music by Them's Hunters, food provided by Crushed Ice Events and wine by Old 502 Winery. Hosted by The Monkey Wrench and The Kentucky Guild of Brewers. $45, VIP Entry, $75 (includes early entry, special beer tasting and food voucher); designated driver entry, $10 (includes unlimited non-alcoholic drinks).

Jeff Ruby's. 325 W. Main St. Thursday-Saturday, Wednesday, Pete Peterson.

Manny & Merle. 122 W. Main St. Friday and Saturday, Ricky Morse.

Meta. 425 W. Chestnut St. Friday, DJ.

Mercury Ballroom. 611 S. Fourth St. Friday, Goodtimers Annual Fade to Black, Black Friday Birthday Celebration with DJs Efeezy and Znyce, $20. Saturday, Chase Rice: Ignite the Night Tour, $20.

Nowhere Bar. 1133 Bardstown Road. Thursday, DJ Jay Kay. Friday, Glitter Titz. Saturday, DJ. Tuesday, karaoke.

Stevie Ray's. 230 E. Main St. Thursday, open jam. Friday, Kelly Richie. Saturday, Louisville Fats and the Rhythm Cats, Soul Circus. Tuesday, blues jam. Dec. 3, Blues and Greys.

Third Street Dive. 442 S. Third St. Friday, Josh Peyton, The Bourbonville Buskers, $5. Saturday, Indien, Hello Failure, Ink & Lead, $10.

Central

Check's Cafe. 1101 E. Burnett Ave. Thursday and Saturday, karaoke.

The New Vintage. 2126 S Preston St. Thursday, Purling Hiss, State Champion. Friday, Three Legged Race, Joe Clark, Eric Lanham. Saturday, Friendsgiving with Moonlight Peddlers, $5.

Rudyard Kipling. 422 W. Oak. Thursday, open mic. Friday, Donna Frost.

Zanzabar. 2100 S. Preston. Friday, Karass, Thing Shape, $5. Saturday, Kat Dahlia, Craig Stickland, $12.

East

Air Devil's Inn. 2802 Taylorsville Road. Monday, karaoke.

Baxter's 942 Bar & Grill. 942 Baxter Ave. Friday, JD Shelburne. Saturday, Jeckel and the Hives.

Diamond Pub. 630 Barret Ave. Friday, Coffi and Dubloadz, Riddim Roast. Saturday, Glow Party with DJ Ace, Beatsmackers.

Drakes. 3939 Shelbyville Road. Thursday-Saturday, DJ.

Gerstle's Place. 3801 Frankfort Ave. Thursday, Me & You. Friday, 64 West, War Panties. Saturday, Thumper & the Plaid Rabbits, Happy Hour, Sand Bar Soul. Sunday, The Pranksters. Monday, Petar Mandic. Tuesday, Strung Out Loud. Dec. 3, Kimmet & Doug.

Headliners Music Hall. 1836 Lexington Road. Friday, The Werks, Getzy & Derek LaFountain, $12 advance, $15 day of show. Tuesday, Glass Animals, $12 advance, $15 day of show.

Hideaway Saloon. 1607 Bardstown Road. Thursday, The Pranksters. Friday, Positive Mental Attitude, $5. Saturday, The Stolen Faces.

Highland Taproom. 1058 Bardstown Road. Friday-Sunday, karaoke.

Jack Fry's. 1007 Bardstown Road. Thursday, Ray Johnson. Friday, Saturday and Monday, Steve Crews. Tuesday and Wednesday, Ray Johnson, Jenna Mattingly, Dave Wilson.

Jerry Green & Friends. 2800 Breckenridge Lane. Wednesday and Thursday, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.; Friday and Saturday, 9 p.m.-3 a.m., Jerry Green & Friends Band (pop/Motown). Wednesday and Friday, 7-9 p.m., Freddy George. Sunday-Tuesday, karaoke.

Jim Porter's. 2345 Lexington Road. Friday, 1 p.m., Black Friday Ball with Youngstown Parade, Circus, Big Dogs Bite, Mean Streak, Addiction, Six Miles South, The Tarnations, The Over-Reactors, Holly Nelson, Drunk & Sailor, Brian Elmore, Ashley Ledrick, Drew Alexander, Joe D'Amato. Benefiting the Make-A-Wish Foundation; families welcome until 10 p.m., $10. Friday and Saturday, Rick Barlett's Rockin' Soul Revival, The Degenerates, Bluestown. Tuesday, Bop Night. Dec. 3, Mixed Bag Wednesday.

Majid's. 3930 Chenoweth Square. Thursday, Tanita Gaines. Friday and Saturday, Bobby J and Michael Roy. Tuesday, Barb & Eddie.

Molly Malone's. 3900 Shelbyville Road. Thursday, Petar Mandic. Friday and Saturday, DJ.

O'Shea's. 956 Baxter Ave. Friday and Saturday, DJ.

Phoenix Hill Tavern. 644 Baxter Ave. Thursday, Fox Gobble Stock with Jefferson Tarc Bus Reunion. Friday, Killer Lips, Mark Jackson. Saturday, Rock For Kosair, 7:30, features 15 bands, three stages and four guitar giveaways. Performers include Infantry #333, The Smokin Gorillas, 16 Bones, Deadlight Redemption, Signal the Revolution, Zebras In Public, Unleashed, Krosjoint, Grindstone, Rock Brigade, Bury the Wicked, Year of the Gun, Mooseknuckle, Digg, Jayson William Allen, John Hager and others. Proceeds from the show will buy toys for Kosair Kids, $10. Dec. 3, Soul Creek, Tom Cool.

Wick's. 975 Baxter Ave. Friday, Shotgun Holler. Saturday, The Kingbees.

Wick's. 2927 Goose Creek Road. Saturday, Battle of the Bands.

Wicks. 12717 Shelbyville Road. Friday, karaoke with host Lisa. Saturday, Dev.

South

BJ's. 8238 Dixie Highway. Saturday, DJ Rip.

Expo Five. 2900 7th Street Road. Tuesday, Black Veil Brides, Falling in Reverse, Set It Off, Drama Club, $25.

JT's Variety Club. 8021 Preston Highway. Thursday, Friday, karaoke with host Chris. Saturday, DJ Bruce with Steve. Friday, Junior Brown. Friday and Saturday, Spare Change, Copperfield, Str8 Jakkit. Tuesday, Bop Night. Oct. 1, DJ Crim's Line Dance Party.

Joe's Older Than Dirt. 8131 New La Grange Road. Thursday and Tuesday, karaoke. Friday-Saturday, DJ.

West

Cole's Place. 2928 W. Kentucky St. Friday-Saturday, DJ.

Joe's Palm Room. 1821 W. Jefferson St. Thursday-Friday, Frankie and Ralph Adams, DJ Wynn. Thursday, karaoke with host Marcus. Saturday, Mr. Wonderful Productions.

Legends. 2523 W. Broadway. Friday and Saturday, DJ.

Indiana

Wick's. 225 State St., New Albany. Thursday, open mic. Friday, Shane Dawson Band. Saturday, The Blues & Greys, Jingle Walk.
